ColDiffTest¶

class extremals.ColDiffTest(key1, key2, normalized=False, name=None)[source]¶

Bases: extremals.Test

It tests the difference between columns key1 and key2: the function self.function maps a row to the difference of the values corresponding to the two columns.

Parameters:
  • key1 (str) – column key of some dataframe
  • key2 (str) – column key of some dataframe
  • normalized (bool) – if True, the test is normalized, default False
  • name (str or None) – optional name, default None: self.name is set to key2 - key1

Examples: we consider the dataframe data

cdtest = xt.ColDiffTest('col1','col2')
result = cdtest.Apply(data)

# result is just data['col2'] - data['col1'] sorted and without NaN values.
l   -567.0
c   -124.0
f    -43.5
h     -5.0
i      3.0
g     73.0
a     97.0
b    100.0
Name: (col2 - col1), dtype: float64


cdtest.normalized = True
# or cdtest = extremal.ColDiffTest('col1','col2', normalized = True)
result_nor = cdtest.Apply(data)

# result_nor is the normalization of result
l   -0.877143
c   -0.113267
f    0.025542
h    0.091928
i    0.105723
g    0.226426
a    0.267809
b    0.272982
Name: (col2 - col1), dtype: float64
